HDG.LOG.content: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)

HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: omologein as when fateful comes to pass, proper hearing [when does fateful not come to pass? Nietzsche, Derrida], the laying that gathering has sent (die lesende Lege geschickt hat): where, and as what, does the fateful presence?

HDG.LOG.content: logos essentially occurs as en panta [wholeness] > [all uniting is the one, gathering, centrifugal] > logos, gathering everything (alles) in the totality (All) of simple presencing? > Der logos legt ins Anwesen vor und legt das Anwesende ins Anwesen nieder, d.h. zurück [heterotautology: laying back into presence what is present before] > presencing: having come forward to endure in unconcealment (hervorgekommen im Unverborgenen währen) [endure, linger awhile, totality]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: logos essentially occurs as en panta [wholeness] > [all uniting is the one, gathering, centrifugal] > logos, gathering everything (alles) in the totality (All) of simple presencing? > Der logos legt ins Anwesen vor und legt das Anwesende ins Anwesen nieder, d.h. zurück [heterotautology: laying back into presence what is present before] > presencing: having come forward to endure in unconcealment (hervorgekommen im Unverborgenen währen) [endure, linger awhile, totality]

HDG.LOG.content: en as Zeus [as legein?] [?] > [Zeus: highest present being—not Being???] > to name, to call forward, that which is laid down/gathered in name comes to light [Zeus as the dispatcher, lightning bolt as sending, of gathering]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: en as Zeus [as legein?] [?] > [Zeus: highest present being—not Being???] > to name, to call forward, that which is laid down/gathered in name comes to light [Zeus as the dispatcher, lightning bolt as sending, of gathering]

HDG.IM.content: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision
HDG.IM.linkedContent: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.BC.content: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]

HDG.BC.content: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]

HDG.BC.content: reflection saves us, inner choice (innere Wahl): what alone remains essence comes into view almost (fast) of itself [causa sui?], attend to what we can do w/out, choose whether or not to expose (ausgesetzt) ourselves to claim essential (Anspruch des Wesenhaften) makes on us > each person responsible for himself, for his delusions, for that which he holds himself ready
HDG.BC.linkedContent: reflection saves us, inner choice (innere Wahl): what alone remains essence comes into view almost (fast) of itself [causa sui?], attend to what we can do w/out, choose whether or not to expose (ausgesetzt) ourselves to claim essential (Anspruch des Wesenhaften) makes on us > each person responsible for himself, for his delusions, for that which he holds himself ready

HDG.BC.content: what is thoughtworthy isn’t “thinking” but what challenges thinking, what places thinking in its service, bestows rank/value on it [thinking beyond “logic” as pathos of distance?]: extend thinking toward manner in which ground includes us in its essence, come into proximity w/ what strikes us essential, become aware, listen our way to where we belong [Gelassenheit]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: what is thoughtworthy isn’t “thinking” but what challenges thinking, what places thinking in its service, bestows rank/value on it [thinking beyond “logic” as pathos of distance?]: extend thinking toward manner in which ground includes us in its essence, come into proximity w/ what strikes us essential, become aware, listen our way to where we belong [Gelassenheit]

HDG.BC.content: history (arbitrarily), happening (Ereignis) of a decision about essence of truth, Ereignis is exceptional > man fails to see/recognize simple history: confused/habituated to multiplicity of ordinary [Mitsein] > remembrance of the inception: readiness for what is to come > distinguish what does matter from what doesn’t (groundless): let us allow ourselves to be struck by incipient
HDG.BC.linkedContent: history (arbitrarily), happening (Ereignis) of a decision about essence of truth, Ereignis is exceptional > man fails to see/recognize simple history: confused/habituated to multiplicity of ordinary [Mitsein] > remembrance of the inception: readiness for what is to come > distinguish what does matter from what doesn’t (groundless): let us allow ourselves to be struck by incipient

HDG.BC.content: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)

HDG.BC.content: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)

HDG.BC.content: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]

HDG.BC.content: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.BC.content: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.BT.content: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts

HDG.BT.content: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]

HDG.WM.content: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

HDG.IWM.content: Nothing understood as Being itself > Heidegger reframes fundamental question of metaphysics: “how does it come about that with Being It [cf. 290n For metaphysics] is really nothing and that the Nothing does not properly prevail?” [i.e. how does metaphysics forget Being as Nothing?]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: Nothing understood as Being itself > Heidegger reframes fundamental question of metaphysics: “how does it come about that with Being It [cf. 290n For metaphysics] is really nothing and that the Nothing does not properly prevail?” [i.e. how does metaphysics forget Being as Nothing?]

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

HDG.FS.content: diapheromenon (of Heraclitus) unfolding (Entfaltung) of contraries, grounded in inapparent character (Unscheinbaren) of logos > opposites exclude, contraries correspond (“Die Gegensätze schliessen einander aus, während die Widerwendigen sich entsprechen”) > [correspond as letting each other reciprocally come forth]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: diapheromenon (of Heraclitus) unfolding (Entfaltung) of contraries, grounded in inapparent character (Unscheinbaren) of logos > opposites exclude, contraries correspond (“Die Gegensätze schliessen einander aus, während die Widerwendigen sich entsprechen”) > [correspond as letting each other reciprocally come forth]

HDG.FS.content: sound not extended in space, only in time: still it comes from a place (Ort), traverses/measures space
HDG.FS.linkedContent: sound not extended in space, only in time: still it comes from a place (Ort), traverses/measures space

HDG.FS.content: [Heidegger on Aufheben] sublation as 1) “to place something on,” let opposites come forth, sublation = to Latin “tollere,” taking (tolle, lege) [Aufhebung as take up & read?] 2) Latin “elevare” 3) preserving, conserving, brining to a safe place
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Heidegger on Aufheben] sublation as 1) “to place something on,” let opposites come forth, sublation = to Latin “tollere,” taking (tolle, lege) [Aufhebung as take up & read?] 2) Latin “elevare” 3) preserving, conserving, brining to a safe place

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”

HDG.FS.content: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “Time and Being” thought “letting” as “giving (Geben)” > giving speaks in Es gibt (il y a too ontic of a translation, refers to presence of beings) > too ontic to understand Es Gibt as letting come to presence, as if it means “to make present” > rather think Es gibt re: letting itself, presence no longer emphasized: “to let the presencing (Lassen das Anwesen)” [still presence there?] (presence of a being no long draws one’s attention but ground the being covers over to stand independent) > letting as gift (Gabe), gives only its gift, withdraws/holds back (verbirgt)

HDG.FS.content: no destinal (geschickliche) epoch of Ereignis: sending is from enowning (Das Schicken ist aus dem Ereignen) > return to Greeks only has meaning as a return to Being [?] > “step back (Schritt züruck)” (step that retreats [züruckgeht] from metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics]) has sole meaning of enabling (ermöglichen) glance ahead (Vorausblick) to what comes (was kommt) [to-come], thinking begins anew: in essence of technology thought catches sight of heralding portent (verdeckenden Vor-Schein), die verbergende Vor-Erscheinung des Ereignisses selbst
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no destinal (geschickliche) epoch of Ereignis: sending is from enowning (Das Schicken ist aus dem Ereignen) > return to Greeks only has meaning as a return to Being [?] > “step back (Schritt züruck)” (step that retreats [züruckgeht] from metaphysics [overcoming metaphysics]) has sole meaning of enabling (ermöglichen) glance ahead (Vorausblick) to what comes (was kommt) [to-come], thinking begins anew: in essence of technology thought catches sight of heralding portent (verdeckenden Vor-Schein), die verbergende Vor-Erscheinung des Ereignisses selbst

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on French regarder, letting what I am looking at come near me, to safe-guard (ge-warhen; re-garder), the having-seen for consciousness [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on French regarder, letting what I am looking at come near me, to safe-guard (ge-warhen; re-garder), the having-seen for consciousness [?]

HDG.FS.content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

HDG.CCP.content: waiting (warten) is not awaiting (erwarten): done waiting when we represent what we are waiting for > remaining is a returning > openness itself is Gegnet, into which we’re released by waiting when we think > thinking: coming-into-the-nearness of distance > how come you suddenly could wait?
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: waiting (warten) is not awaiting (erwarten): done waiting when we represent what we are waiting for > remaining is a returning > openness itself is Gegnet, into which we’re released by waiting when we think > thinking: coming-into-the-nearness of distance > how come you suddenly could wait?

HDG.CCP.content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.DL.content: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages
HDG.DL.linkedContent: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages

HDG.DL.content: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]

HDG.DL.content: language as Koto ba > Koto: Ereignis (of lightening message of grace), that which gives delight, itself, that which, uniquely in each unrepeatable moment (unwiederholbaren Augenblick) comes to radiance (Scheinen) in fullness of its grace [instant of gift]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language as Koto ba > Koto: Ereignis (of lightening message of grace), that which gives delight, itself, that which, uniquely in each unrepeatable moment (unwiederholbaren Augenblick) comes to radiance (Scheinen) in fullness of its grace [instant of gift]

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language
HDG.DL.linkedContent: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

HDG.DL.content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

HDG.LP.content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]

HDG.WL.content: mystery (Geheimnis) of language: language speaks solely w/ itself alone (Sie spricht einzig und einsam mit sich selber) > if we experience the way to language re: what happens along the way [rather than using scientific propositions], an intimation (Vermutung) may come in which language strikes us (anmutet) as strange
HDG.WL.linkedContent: mystery (Geheimnis) of language: language speaks solely w/ itself alone (Sie spricht einzig und einsam mit sich selber) > if we experience the way to language re: what happens along the way [rather than using scientific propositions], an intimation (Vermutung) may come in which language strikes us (anmutet) as strange

HDG.WL.content: we let the soundless voice come to us, then demand, reach out, call for the sound already kept in store (aufbehaltenen Laut) for us
HDG.WL.linkedContent: we let the soundless voice come to us, then demand, reach out, call for the sound already kept in store (aufbehaltenen Laut) for us

HDG.WL.content: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: in the Erläuterung des Sprachwesens as Saying (Sage), our way to language has reached its goal (Ziel), reached language as such [arrival] [so it seems] > in truth, our reflection has only come w/in sight of Weg zur Sprache it is seeking, is barely on its traces (Spur)

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

HDG.WL.content: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

HDG.EC.content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

HDG.EC.content: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]

HDG.EC.content: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present
HDG.EC.linkedContent: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present

HDG.EC.content: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming
HDG.EC.linkedContent: if we were not already in essence those who wait, we could never become so [attention to Being] > we are only what we seek > seek only that on which we wait > wait on that in which we belong > we belong to the coming as the Gegenwart (present-waiting-toward) > as Gegenwart we release (lassen) ourselves to the coming, and in so releasing we 1st come into our own (eigen) > all these sentences say the selfsame > none can be preconceived, each thinks ahead (vordenkt) into the coming

HDG.EC.content: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]

HDG.OHF.content: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]

HDG.OHF.content: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Dilthey continues Schleiermacher’s reduction] the developments of hermeneutics (Patristic period and Luther) hidden from Dilthey > still, watering-down of Dilthey today can’t come close to his position re: hermeneutics

HDG.OHF.content: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: need a straightforward presentation (schlichte Vergegenwärtigung) of what the world is being encountered as, corresponding to our forehaving, in the now & soon to come of the particular awhileness of average everydayness > the awhileness (Jeweilikgeit) is a circumscribed situation (umgrenzte Lage), circumscribed by the particular givens closest to us (jeweilges Zünachst) [Zünachst as both now and proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
